channel.title: BBC Sport - Sport
channel.description: The latest stories from the Sport section of the BBC Sport web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Van Persie out for up to six weeks
item.description: Manchester United striker Robin van Persie is ruled out for between four and six weeks with a knee injury.

item.title: Man Utd face Bayern in Champions League
India thrash Pakistan in World T20
Spring Classics: A race-by-race guide
item.description: Spartacus prepares to race against the Terminator as the annual one-day Spring Classics get going across Europe

item.title: England must win T20 opener - Broad
Sport Relief aiming to raise £50m
item.description: David Beckham, Kylie Minogue, Sebastian Coe and David Walliams are among the stars trying to raise £50m for charity as part of Sport Relief.

item.title: Bruce criticises FA over Boyd ban
item.description: Hull City manager Steve Bruce wants the disciplinary system changed after George Boyd's appeal against a ban is rejected.

item.title: Aguero ruled out of Manchester derby
item.description: Manchester City top scorer Sergio Aguero will miss Tuesday's Manchester derby at Old Trafford with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Ospreys 34-9 Cardiff Blues
item.description: Ospreys outclass Cardiff Blues to consolidate their place in the the top four of the Pro12 in a one-sided game.

item.title: Ireland knocked out by Netherlands
Red Bull given Ricciardo appeal date
item.description: Red Bull will have their appeal against Daniel Ricciardo's disqualification from the Australian Grand Prix heard on 14 April.

item.title: Tour de France in £2.3m shortfall
item.description: The organisers of the Tour de France's Grand Depart in England underestimate the cost of staging the event by £2.3m, a report finds.

item.title: Brown named Six Nations best player
item.description: England full-back Mike Brown wins Six Nations Player of the Championship ahead of retiring Ireland legend Brian O'Driscoll.

item.title: Mourinho will contest FA charge
England women thrash NZ in warm-up
item.description: Anya Shrubsole takes four wickets as England skittle New Zealand for 48 in a warm-up for the Women's World Twenty20.

item.title: Cavendish coy on Milan-San Remo chance
item.description: Manxman Mark Cavendish plays down his chances of winning a second Milan-San Remo title in Sunday's one-day classic.

item.title: Massaro battles to world semi-finals
item.description: England's Laura Massaro wins a dramatic five-game match to reach the semi-finals of the squash World Championship in Malaysia.

item.title: Russia 2018 'not affected by Crimea'
item.description: Fifa president Sepp Blatter says the 2018 World Cup will go ahead in Russia, despite the nation annexing Crimea.

item.title: Games delayed in Hillsborough tribute
item.description: Games will kick off seven minutes late on 11-14 April to mark the 25th anniversary of the Hillsborough disaster.

item.title: Olympian Yarnold gets hero's welcome
item.description: Hundreds of people turn out to give Winter Olympic champion Lizzy Yarnold a hero's welcome during an an open top bus parade in her honour.

item.title: Gallantree's medal misery in Dubai
item.description: Britain's Rebecca Gallantree just misses a medal in the three-metre springboard at the Diving World Series in Dubai.

item.title: Jockey Tizzard retires aged 34
item.description: Jump jockey Joe Tizzard announces his surprise retirement as a professional rider at the age of 34.

item.title: Wales face Hibbard SA tour blow
item.description: Wales could be without British and Irish Lions hooker Richard Hibbard for their two-Tests tour to South Africa in June.

item.title: Stokes has surgery on injured wrist
item.description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has surgery on the fractured wrist which ruled him out of the current World Twenty20.

item.title: VIDEO: Five great Arsenal goals under Wenger
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at five great goals scored by Arsenal under the stewardship of Arsene Wenger, who will take charge of the Gunners for the 1000th time this weekend.

item.title: VIDEO: Wenger 'privileged' to reach milestone
item.description: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger feels he wouldn't have made to the milestone of his 1,000th game in charge if the club had not always supported him.

item.title: VIDEO: All Wenger's Premier League rivals
item.description: As Arsene Wenger prepares to take charge of his 1,000th game at Arsenal, BBC Sport takes a look back at the many managers who have graced the Premier League since his arrival.

item.title: VIDEO: Wenger's Arsenal in numbers
item.description: BBC Sport looks at some key statistics from Arsene Wenger's time in charge at Arsenal ahead of the legendary French manager's 1,000th game in charge of the Gunners.

item.title: VIDEO: Mourinho 'admires' Wenger
item.description: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho says he would love to have the "privilege" of being employed by the same club for 1000 matches as Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger reaches that milestone.

item.title: VIDEO: Wenger milestone remarkable - Dein
item.description: Former Arsenal vice-chairman David Dein says it is remarkable that Arsene Wenger has reached the milestone of 1,000 games in charge of the club.

item.title: VIDEO: Watch - Sport Relief
item.description: Live coverage of the Sport Relief Appeal Show on the BBC.

item.title: VIDEO: Moyes 'ashamed' of some United displays
item.description: Manchester United manager David Moyes says he was able to look supporters "in the face" after their Champions League win over Olympiakos, having previously "ashamed" of some performances.

item.title: VIDEO: Bruce 'outraged' by Boyd suspension
item.description: Hull City boss Steve Bruce says he is "outraged" at the FA's decision to charge George Boyd with misconduct for allegedly spitting at Manchester City's Joe Hart.

item.title: VIDEO: No rush for new coach - Murray
item.description: British number one Andy Murray says he will not rush into a decision about a new coach, as it will be "tough" to replace Ivan Lendl.

item.title: VIDEO: Liverpool can win league - Solskjaer
item.description: Cardiff City manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says his side's next opponents, Liverpool, can win the Premier League title.

item.title: VIDEO: Matic settling back into life at Chelsea
item.description: Nemanja Matic thanks his Chelsea team-mates for helping him to settle back into life at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: VIDEO: Mourinho the master of mischief
item.description: BBC Sport looks at some of the mischievous things Jose Mourinho has said since returning to Chelsea, including comments about other managers, notably Arsenal's Arsene Wenger.

item.title: VIDEO: Gosport's FA Trophy final song
item.description: Gosport punk band perform their FA Trophy song for BBC South Today ahead of the Wembley final on Sunday.

item.title: VIDEO: Motherwell 2-0 Inverness CT
item.description: Motherwell strengthen their position in the Scottish Premiership's top three with victory over Inverness (UK users only).

item.title: VIDEO: Get Inspired for Sport Relief 2014
item.description: Get Inspired want to get you active this year, so why don't you start by running, swimming or cycling a mile for the 2014 Sport Relief Games?

item.title: VIDEO: BBC pundits on Ricciardo exclusion
item.description: David Coulthard and Allan McNish on the exclusion of Red Bull's Daniel Ricciardo from the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: England's memorable World Cup songs
item.description: BBC Sport presents a selection of England's most memorable World Cup songs, in anticipation of the launch of the official 2014 track on Friday.

item.title: VIDEO: Root 'gutted' to miss World Twenty20
item.description: England batsman Joe Root says it is "gutting" to miss out on the ICC World Twenty20 in Bangladesh through a hand injury.

item.title: VIDEO: Sochi gold medal 'like Frodo's ring'
item.description: Winter Olympian Lizzy Yarnold has been given a hero's welcome during an open-top bus parade in Kent.

item.title: VIDEO: World Cup moments: Rivaldo's 'injury'
item.description: BBC Sport counts down 100 of the greatest World Cup moments, as the 2014 tournament in Brazil draws nearer.

item.title: VIDEO: Fury storms out of Chisora conference
item.description: Tyson Fury flips over a table before walking out of a press conference promoting his heavyweight clash against Dereck Chisora.

item.title: VIDEO: A look at England's World Cup song
item.description: BBC Sport Relief joins forces with Gary Barlow and many other familiar faces to produce the 2014 World Cup song for England.

item.title: VIDEO: David Beckham joins Only Fools
item.description: David Beckham joins the cast of Only Fools and Horses for a special sketch to raise money for Sport Relief

item.title: VIDEO: Liverpool a joy to watch - Rodgers
item.description: Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers says his team are a joy to watch at the moment in the race for the Premier League title.

item.title: VIDEO: Man Utd won in style - Moyes
item.description: Manager David Moyes is delighted by Manchester United's Champions League win over Olympiakos, saying his team won "in style".

item.title: VIDEO: Disabled fans 'discriminated against'
item.description: A BBC study has found that only three of the 20 top-flight stadiums currently provide the required number of wheelchair spaces.

item.title: VIDEO: Guide to the Indian Premier League
item.description: Watch BBC Sport's guide to the Indian Premier League ahead of the 2014 season, which takes place from April until June.

item.title: VIDEO: Six Nations: Tries of the tournament
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at a selection of the best tries from the 2014 Six Nations championship.

item.title: A game of charades made me recruit Wenger - Dein
item.description: Former Arsenal executive David Dein recalls his seven-year pursuit of Arsene Wenger which all began at a dinner party

item.title: Moyes faces David v Goliath battle
item.description: Manchester United face a tough Bayern Munich test in the Champions League last eight, but Chelsea will have optimism

item.title: Lawro's predictions v Eliza Doolittle
item.description: BBC Sport's football expert Mark Lawrenson takes on Sport Relief singer Eliza Doolittle

item.title: 'England lack power to challenge for World T20'
item.description: An out-of-form England will be happy to progress from the World T20 group stages, says cricket correspondent Jonathan Agnew

item.title: What Wenger’s 1996 rivals made of ‘Arsene who?’
item.description: "Charming", "stubborn" and "ruthless". Managers from Arsene Wenger's first season in England discuss his 1,000-game reign

item.title: 'Quiet' engine debate rumbles on
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone surely has more pressing issues to deal with in F1 than engine noise, says chief F1 writer Andrew Benson

item.title: The European giants battling for the Champions League
item.description: Andy Brassell looks at the six Champions League teams standing in the way of Chelsea and Man Utd winning the trophy

item.title: Must-not-miss sport on the BBC
item.description: Your guide to the latest sporting events on the BBC, including cricket, football and Sport Relief

item.title: World Twenty20 team-by-team guide
item.description: Which side bowled another out for 10? Who faced Allan Donald without a helmet? BBC Sport's team-by-team guide

item.title: Brand to guest on Match of the Day
item.description: Comedian and West Ham fan Russell Brand is to be a guest pundit on Saturday's Match of the Day show for Sport Relief.

item.title: Murrayfield pitch plea by Edinburgh
item.description: Edinburgh fans are urged not to take away souvenirs of Murrayfield's infected pitch after the match with Ulster.

item.title: I want to play in four World Cups - Adam Jones
item.description: In his BBC column, Wales prop Adam Jones talks about ambitions, landmarks and competition from the youngsters

item.title: Farah should refocus, says Cram
item.description: Ex-world champion Steve Cram says Mo Farah should "move on" and not worry about collapsing in the New York half-marathon.

item.title: Fury flips table at press conference
item.description: Tyson Fury overturns a table before storming out of a press conference to promote his heavyweight clash with Dereck Chisora.

item.title: Injury rules Wakely out for season
item.description: Northamptonshire limited-overs captain Alex Wakely is likely to miss the 2014 season with a ruptured Achilles tendon.

item.title: Thomas is future Tour winner - Sutton
item.description: Geraint Thomas will follow Sir Bradley Wiggins and Chris Froome by winning the Tour de France, says coach Shane Sutton.

item.title: Top clubs warned over disabled fans
item.description: The Committee on Olympic and Paralympic Legacy says urgent changes must be made for disabled fans at football grounds.

item.title: Lorient v Paris St-Germain
item.description: Live coverage of Friday's French Ligue 1 game between Lorient and Paris St-Germain.

item.title: F1 dispute over 'too quiet' engines
item.description: McLaren team boss Eric Boullier defends Formula 1's new engines in the wake of complaints they have an uninspiring sound.

item.title: Scott shoots record 62 at Bay Hill
item.description: Masters champion Adam Scott ties the course record with an opening round of 62 at the Arnold Palmer Invitational in Florida.

item.title: Maguire home after Stratford fall
item.description: Jockey Jason Maguire returns home after a fall at Stratford which led to him being placed in a medically-induced coma.

item.title: Marquez favourite as new-look MotoGP returns
item.description: New riders, new teams, new rule changes - Azi Farni guides you through the new MotoGP season

item.title: Redgrave tips record Rio medal glory
item.description: Sir Steve Redgrave predicts Team GB will eclipse London 2012 to set a new medal record at the Rio Olympics in 2016.

item.title: Wane hails Wigan's 'convincing' win
item.description: Coach Shaun Wane praises his Wigan side for a "convincing" 12-4 victory over Warrington Wolves on Thursday.

item.title: Bath warned against play-off 'failure'
item.description: Bath head coach Mike Ford says securing anything less than a Premiership play-off place would be a "failure" for the club.

item.title: Murphy holds off Selby to win title
item.description: Shaun Murphy fends off a fightback from Mark Selby to claim the Haikou World Open title 10-6 in China.

item.title: GB synchro squad set for first event
item.description: The new-look GB synchronised swimming team are in Paris for their first international competition together.

item.title: Nieminen breaks Rusedski record
item.description: Jarkko Nieminen beats Greg Rusedski's 18-year-old record for the fastest ATP Tour win as the Finn thrashes Bernard Tomic.

item.title: Olympic champion Hoefl-Riesch retires
item.description: Three-time Olympic champion Maria Hoefl-Riesch retires from professional skiing at the age of 29.

item.title: Clubs will fail cash rules - McCarthy
item.description: Ipswich Town boss Mick McCarthy says he expects some fellow Championship clubs to fall foul of the Financial Fair Play rules.

item.title: Judy Murray sad at loss of Lendl
item.description: Judy Murray says she is in mourning over the decision to end Ivan Lendl's spell as coach to her son, Andy.

item.title: Liverpool 'a terrific opportunity'
item.description: Most fans expect Cardiff to earn nothing from Saturday's game against Liverpool, says manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

item.title: AUDIO: Edinburgh v Ulster commentary
item.description: Live BBC Radio Ulster Medium Wave coverage of the Pro12 fixture between Edinburgh and Ulster from Murrayfield.
